intro: Thryptomene plicata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thryptomene, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Thryptomene plicata is often found in dry, open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands.
